import FolderTreeExpandCollapse from './FolderTreeExpandCollapse?dev-site-example';

# Expand/Collapse

### Description

The following example demonstrates expandable/collapsible folders.

### Required Properties

Expanded/collapsed state is controlled by the consuming component.
The following FolderTreeItem props are required for expand/collapse:
* **[isExpanded](../about#foldertreeitem-props-table)**: Identifies whether or not the FolderTreeItem is currently expanded. 
* **[onToggle](../about#foldertreeitem-props-table)**: This callback is called when interacting with a row that has `subfolderItems` via either of the following methods:
  * Mouse click:
    * Clicking anywhere on a row that has `subfolderItems`, other than on the radio button.
  * Keyboard:
    * Pressing Right Arrow on a focused, collapsed row that has `subfolderItems`, or Left Arrow on a focused, expanded row that has `subfolderItems`.
* **[subfolderItems](../about#foldertreeitem-props-table)**: Only FolderTreeItems that have `subfolderItems` with 1 or more items can be expanded/collapsed.
These FolderTreeItems will always display a folder icon.

```js
// Initialize folders to be collapsed
const [expandedItems, setExpandedItems] = React.useState({
  "row-item-1": false
});

const handleExpandCollapse = (key) => {
  const newExpandedItems = {
    ...expandedItems,
    [key]: !expandedItems[key],
  };
  setExpandedItems(newExpandedItems);
};

<FolderTree.Item
  key="row-item-1"
  label="Projects"
  isExpanded={expandedItems["row-item-1"]}
  onToggle={() => {handleExpandCollapse("row-item-1")}}
  subfolderItems=[...]
/>
```

<FolderTreeExpandCollapse />
